1.text: Roll 2 dice to determine which player will go first.

2.text: Hand each player 5 dice along with a dice cup.

3.text: Have everyone roll their 5 dice at the same time, keeping them hidden.

4.text: Let the first player guess how many total of one dice face were rolled.

5.text: Allow the other players to challenge the bet or make a new one.

6.text: Continue around the table making new bets until there's a challenge.

7.text: Reveal all the players’ dice when a player challenges a bet.

8.text: Begin the next round with the loser of the previous round.

9.text: Repeat rounds until there’s only one player with dice left.

10.text: Figure out who will start the game by each rolling 5 dice.

11.text: Roll the 5 poker dice all at once, keeping them hidden.

12.text: Announce the poker hand you rolled or are pretending to have rolled.

13.text: Allow the other player a chance to challenge your hand.

14.text: Pass the dice to your opponent if no challenge is made.

15.text: Have the other player roll the dice and announce a higher poker hand.

16.text: Challenge or accept your opponent’s announcement.

17.text: Play until there are no poker chips left.
